arts.ttl: Kylian Mbappé fires Real Madrid to winning start for Alonso against Osasuna
arts.sum: Kylian Mbappé’s second-half penalty secured for Real Madrid a hard-fought 1-0 home victory against Osasuna in their opening La Liga game of the season on Tuesday, giving Xabi Alonso a winning start in his first league match in charge of the hosts. After struggling to break down a stubborn Osasuna defence in the opening half, Mbappé won the penalty and converted from the spot six minutes after the break to give Real the lead, but the home side were unable to increase their advantage. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Mbappe makes Osasuna pay penalty in Alonso's Bernabeu return
arts.sum: Real Madrid start their first La Liga campaign under Xabi Alonso with a win after Kylian Mbappe makes the difference in Monday's clash against Osasuna at the Santiago Bernabeu.

arts.ttl: Real Madrid 1-0 Osasuna: Report & Full Match Highlights as Los Blancos Start With A Win
arts.sum: Kylian Mbappe had the first half chance of the game in the 25th minute, Vinicius Jr. did well from the left and cut it back to the Frenchman, who scuffed his shot towards goal. Real Madrid got precisely what they wanted early in the second half, and it was always going to be the club's new No. 10 who broke the deadlock.

arts.ttl: Real Madrid Player Ratings vs. Osasuna: Kylian Mbappe Delivers 1–0 Victory in La Liga Opener
arts.sum: The Xabi Alonso era in Spain kicked off with a comfortable win under the lights at the Santiago Bernabéu.

arts.ttl: Real Madrid vs Osasuna: Confirmed Starting Lineup Announced for La Liga Clash
arts.sum: Alonso does start three of his four summer signings, with Álvaro Carreras starting at left-back, Huisjen at center-back, and Alexander-Arnold at right-back. Head coach Xabi Alonso has had the Club World Cup to look at some of his players, including new signings Trent Alexander-Arnold and Dean Huijsen.

arts.ttl: Official: Real Madrid starting lineup against Osasuna | La Liga MD1
arts.sum: Real Madrid will finally get their 2025/26 La Liga season underway tonight as they host CA Osasuna at the Santiago Bernabeu in an hour or so. Ahead of kickoff, manager Xabi Alonso, making his debut in La Liga, has announced the starting lineup for his first match in charge at the Santiago Bernabeu. arts.ttl: How to Watch Real Madrid vs. Osasuna on TV, Live Stream
arts.sum: Xabi Alonso will hope to lead his team to three points in his first La Liga match in charge of Real Madrid.

arts.ttl: Why Could Real Madrid Face Disciplinary Action If Franco Mastantuono Plays Against Osasuna?
arts.sum: However, if it is seen as a way of bending the rules, with the club having every intention of playing the player in the senior team despite not registering him in the senior squad, it could be seen as an improper lineup. The reason for the possible action is that La Liga teams are allowed to register players in the youth set-up and play them in the senior squad.

arts.ttl: Osasuna will not file an ‘improper lineup’ complaint against Real Madrid over Mastantuono registration
arts.sum: Real Madrid welcomed Franco Mastantuono into the fold last week, nearly two months after completing his signing from River Plate in a deal worth total €63 million.
